text.p: Aberfoyle Ltd said on Tuesday that it achieved mixed production results from its Hellyer base metals operation in Tasmania in first 1996/97 quarter and had plans to significantly increase copper cathode output from the Gunpowder operation in Queensland by the end of calendar 1996.
Zinc concentrate output fell to 58,103 tonnes in the quarter ended September 30 from 65,849 tonnes a year earlier. Lead concentrate production rose to 19,383 tonnes from 16,915 tonnes.
Aberfoyle said copper cathode output at Gunpowder was 1,663 tonnes, its first quarter as a company division.
"Copper cathode production rates have increased from 5,000 tonnes per year in June when Gunpowder was acquired, to 7,000 tonnes per year in September," the company said.
"A rate of 10,000 tonnes per year is targetted by the end of calendar 1996."

The company said a feasibility study was now underway to expand the Gunpowder operation to 40,000 tonnes per year, with an examination of the delineation of ore reserves and pilot plant testing of a new tank leaching process.
First quarter ended September 30 (in tonnes unless otherwise stated)
